results.title: Finding the balance: Arnhem Land
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Researchers have found that the Alligator Rivers region in Arnhem Land has the richest assortment of wilflife of any comparable area known in Australia. This film documents the scientists that piece together a comprehensive picture of the fauna in this area.

results.title: Fighting fire with fire
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Focuses on the research CSIRO have undertaken to understand wind, the most complex of environmental factors associated with bushfires. Sometimes exceeding 150 kilometres an hour, these winds can uproot huge trees, throwing them about like matches.

results.title: Csironet
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Today computers have many more applications outside science than in it. The result has been another information revolution. CSIRONET is CSIRO’s nationwide computer network, linking remote units to the Cyber 76, the most powerful computer in the southern hemisphere. This film shows some applications of the computer and the network.

results.title: Cotton by computer
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
At Narrabri in New South Wales, CSIRO scientists are collaborating with the State Department of Agriculture and cotton farmers in the cause of more efficient production of cotton. A computer based management system is helping them find the best ways of managing the cotton crop, to use fewer pesticides and to increase the harvest.

results.title: Colourful concrete
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
A new product from two technologies. Researchers find that an attractive, permanent weatherproof glaze can be made on a strong concrete block.

results.title: Clear, clean water
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Outlines a new process for water purification called Sirofloc, developed by the CSIRO, and explains it in the context of Australia’s limited water resources. Looks at the first commercial plant in Perth.

results.title: Better weather forecasting
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
The Australian Numerical Meteorological Research Centre uses high powered computers, mathematical models and information from the Bureau of Meteorology in their attempts to improve weather forecasting.

results.title: Australia's most expensive tick
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Extensive research is uncovering a great deal of information about the cattle tick which costs the beef industry of Northern Australia millions of dollars each year.

results.title: Famous women of the past
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: The Queen of Sheba
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Famous women of the past”.
Strange and dramatic pages from the lives of the world’s most famous women. The Queen of Sheba having heard of King Solomon’s wisdom, travels across the desert to Jerusalem to meet him. The journey is one of the greatest overland journeys in history. On her arrival, the King greets her with majestic splendour, cordiality and hospitality. After a six-month stay, the Queen decides to return home. Following a sumptuous banquet in her honour, King Solomon tricks the Queen and satisfies his lust for this woman of great beauty and deep intelligence. The Queen of Sheba returns home and gives birth to a son. King Soloman never sees the Queen again but does finally meet his 16 yeaer old son, who later becomes the King of Abyssinia.
